Execution of unexpected processes or loa.Data: Windows Event ID 4688; Windows Event ID 4624; Windows Event ID 4625
Execution of unexpected processes or loa.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 for process creations associated with DCOM hosts like explr.exe, mmc.exe, or Office applications, originating from remote DCOM/RPC calls. Identify processes or loaded modules/DLLs not typically associated with that application or parent process. Compare the user context of the spawned process with the logged-on user using Event ID 4624/4625 on the target machine. Use frequency analysis to identify rare or anomalous process/DLL combinations or user discrepancies.

Spikes or unusual patterns in DCOM/RPC t.Action: Analyze Zeek conn.log for traffic on port 135 with the RPC service signature. Use time series analysis to detect sudden increases or unusual patterns in traffic volume between internal hosts. Identify source/destination pairs with high DCOM traffic volume or traffic patterns that deviate significantly from the historical baseline using statistical methods like z-score analysis or deviation from median.

Creation of Office application processes.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 for creation of WINWORD.EXE or EXCEL.EXE processes, particularly on servers or endpoints where these are not typically run unattended. Analyze command line arguments for suspicious patterns indicative of DDE execution (e.g., `/dde` switch) or macro execution. Correlate process creation events with preceding DCOM traffic (Zeek conn.log on port 135) from the same source IP, using correlation analysis to link the network activity with host execution.

Remote WMI activity (e.g., process creat.Data: Windows Event ID 4688; Windows Event ID 4624; Zeek conn.log
Remote WMI activity (e.g., process creat.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 for process creation by users or systems associated with remote WMI execution (e.g., `WmiPrvSE.exe` spawning children, command lines with `wmic` or PowerShell WMI commands) occurring on remote systems. Correlate these events with successful network logons (Event ID 4624 Type 3) from the source IP and recent Zeek conn.log entries showing DCOM traffic (port 135) between the same source and destination IPs. Use correlation analysis to link the initial DCOM connection with subsequent WMI-initiated activity.
